properties.Name: Otukaikino community planting day
properties.Notes: Join Council rangers and Trees for Canterbury in a community planting day
properties.Meet: Meet at the Roto Kohatu Reserve (airport end) of Sawyers Arms Road. Follow signs from entrance car park to meeting point.
properties.What-to-bring: Gardening gloves, a spade for planting, sturdy footwear and clothing suitable for all weather conditions.Some tools are available for use.

properties.Name: Styx Mill community planting day
properties.Notes: A free BBQ will follow the planting event.
properties.Meet: Meet in the Hussey Road car-park and look for the signs directing you to the planting site.
properties.What-to-bring:
Gardening gloves, a spade for planting, sturdy footwear and clothing suitable for all weather conditions.

Some tools are available for use.

properties.Name: Thistledown Reserve Restoration Project
properties.Address: Thistledown Reserve, Thistledown Place (off Hargood Street)
properties.Notes: Tasks include planting, pruning, weeding and mulching.
properties.Meet: Meet at the end of Thistledown Place (off Hargood Street).
properties.What-to-bring: Tools and gloves will be provided but please wear sneakers or gumboots as there are several muddy and wet areas we will be working in.

properties.Name: Styx Mill Bird Monitoring Programme
properties.Notes: On the first Saturday of each month, those wishing to participate in the bird monitoring programme meet at the Styx Mill Conservation Reserve on Styx Mill Road at 9am to record the number of individual water bird species using a moving transect method (instruction provided on the day).Two locations are covered during each session to compile a long-term data set for the reserves: The Styx Mill Conservation Reserve andThe 303 Radcliffe Road ReserveData collected is submitted to eBird, and may be explored by anyone with an interest in New Zealand's bird populations.
properties.Meet: Meet at Styx Mill Conservation Reserve, Styx Mill Rd Public Car Park
properties.What-to-bring: Sturdy outdoor clothing and footwear for muddy and wet conditions.You could also bring binoculars, camera, phone, paper and pen.

properties.Time: 30 September to 31 March: 3pm to 5pm. 1 April to 29 September: 2pm to 4pm
properties.Name: Charlesworth Reserve volunteer days
properties.Notes: Come join the ranger team and the Avon-Heathcote Ihutai Estuary Trust every Sunday for our regular working bees, or turn up to one of our large public planting days with Trees for Canterbury.
properties.Meet: Meet at the Charlesworth Wetland car park, located on Charlesworth Street, Brookhaven.
properties.What-to-bring: Appropriate clothing for any weather: sunhat, warm jacket and raincoat. Sturdy footwear or gumboots. Personal work gloves. Tools, sunscreen and gloves are supplied.

properties.Name: Port Hills Reserves volunteer day
properties.Notes: Bring a friend and help us free a tree from weeds. Maintenance is the most critical part of ecological restoration success. Without regular maintenance for the first three years, plants wouldn't survive due to grass competition.
properties.Meet: We will be carpooling from Victoria Park. Meet at the car park behind Victoria Park Visitor Centre no later than 12.45 pm.
properties.What-to-bring: Bring clothes and a hat for all weather events and wear sturdy footwear. Gloves and hedge clippers will be provided or you can bring your own.
